name: swingy
content:
swingy adjective
(MOVEMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
Swingy clothes or hair move easily backwards and forwards or from side to side: She was wearing a long, swingy coat trimmed with fur. She looked great with her fresh skin and short, swingy haircut.
More examplesFewer examplesThe dress is short, sassy, and swingy, but will also look good during the more dignified part of the evening.The styles to look for this season are short, swingy jackets, slim skirts, and flat sandals with laces.They went for forties-inspired dresses with bodices, waists, and swingy skirts.

swingy adjective
(MUSIC)
Swingy music has an attractive rhythm like jazz that you can dance to: The music is funky, bouncy, and swingy in ways that evoke the 1960s and '70s. Their hushed, swingy, closely harmonized vocal sound went down well with the crowd.
More examplesFewer examplesThe band offered more than 90 minutes of jazzy, swingy, funky sounds for the audience.
